channel.title: The evil things we do(in video games)
channel.description:
I was reading this article [url]https://bitmob.com/index.php/mobfeed/the-evil-things-we-do.html[/url] and it was interesting. What evil things have you folks done in video games?
I find it hard to be evil in video games. The worst I have done was harvest all the little sisters in Bioshock.

item.title: The evil things we do(in video games)
item.dc:creator: saivert
item.description:
NavMan:

Flashbang the whole team at the start of a CS:S round

A friend does that to me every fucking time we play Counter-Strike.
And I always throw a nade behind him just before he runs away. hehehe.

Read full topic
item.source: The evil things we do(in video games)

item.title: The evil things we do(in video games)
item.dc:creator: Tei
item.description:
A few weeks ago i discovered a new way to have fun in GTA4.
Once entirely by accident, i bumped into a homeless guy while under the Northwood Heights Bridge and pushed him into the water. For a good hundred feet, there’s no railing to stop people from falling. Pedestrians constantly spawn up on the sidewalk and descend the stairs down towards the water at all hours of the day or night so there’s never a dull moment. if i ever need a good laugh, i just walk down there and stand around waiting for unsuspecting victims i can shove into the river. if you WALK into them, Niko pushes them but it doesn’t count as an attack…meaning nobody will call the cops or retaliate!

if you DO punch a homeless go into the water, the cops will come down to investigate. All you have to do is hop a few feet across to the closest bridge support brace and duck behind the wall. Any cop that tried to apprehend Niko stumbles and falls over the edge into the river. They’re all too stupid to jump! After an hour or two of this and the water starts to fill up with dozens of dead bodies. Hilarious!

Another place i recommend if you like drowning people is Franklin St., in the very north-west corner of Dukes. Just kick all the barriers and safety cones over the edge and you can toss any homeless schmucks and pedestrians into the shallow waters below. if you cause enough ruckus without alerting the police, an ambulance or two may come to drive right over the edge along with your victims. Have fun!

-Kawai Tei-

Read full topic
item.source: The evil things we do(in video games)

item.title: The evil things we do(in video games)
item.dc:creator: GordonFreeman
item.description:
The_Assassin47:

Woah! I forgot about drowing people in rollercoaster tycoon.

Build a bridge, and while people are on it, delete it. They scream, franticly yell, and then drown.

I only did this to people who were pissed off in my park. I’d just lift them up and dump them in the “Angry Man Pond”, specially, designed for such miscreants. It made me fell so good when it did it. It was like, “You don’t like my park eh? Well you will pay for such arrogance with your life!” That was so satisfying, and it increased the happiness of the people in my park.

And I too killed all unneeded scientists and guards in Half-Life. It seems to be a common theme around here.

Read full topic
item.source: The evil things we do(in video games)

item.title: The evil things we do(in video games)
item.dc:creator: DansonDelta40
item.description:
*Sniping in Far Cry 2: Crippling an enemy, so that he cannot move anymore, but is still alive and suffering. Then killing off everybody who runs to help him. Finally, gutting him with a machete (to save ammunition).

*Attacking superior forces, just to hold them off for a while (in every RTS game)

*Flooding entire villages by destruction of a large dam, nuking a Chinese city, using crowds of armed civilians against UN forces, firing anthrax missiles on a major city center (C&C Generals - all part of the single player campaign)

Read full topic

item.title: The evil things we do(in video games)
item.dc:creator: The_Assassin47
item.description:
Ford Prefect:

Where/when is the wedding in Fallout 3?

Fallout3/HL series: Killing every NPC I can the moment they are of no use to me. (For HL, usualy only when I have had a rough day and need to blow off steam.)

Rollercoaster Tycoon: Building coasters that are unfinnished/end in a brick wall and requireing full load to start run.

Woah! I forgot about drowing people in rollercoaster tycoon.

Build a bridge, and while people are on it, delete it. They scream, franticly yell, and then drown.

item.title: The evil things we do(in video games)
item.dc:creator: Neo
item.description:
1. Launched a Liquid Tiberium Bomb in Command and Conquer 3

  2. Stole a Horse in Oblivion

  3. Killed everyone in Khuul in Morrowind

  4. Killed innocents in Assassin’s Creed

  5. Killing Marines on my side in Halo 1 and 2

  6. Killing the Crowd in Wii Baseball(No, really, i do that…)

  7. Killing the Crowd in MX/ATV Unleashed

  8. Killing Cops in Destroy All Humans 1/2/3

  9. Killing Majestic Agents in Destroy All Humans 1

  10. Level Cities in Destroy All Humans 1/2/3

  11. Leveling up offa Killing Innocents in Fable: The Lost Chapters.(I haz both versions)

I could go on, but i don’t want to have this post take Five Years.

Read full topic
